examples: there is much good to be found in people

definitions.text: that which is pleasing or valuable or useful
examples: weigh the good against the bad
among the highest goods of all are happiness and self-realization

definitions.text: having desirable or positive qualities especially those suitable for a thing specified
examples: when she was good she was very very good
a good knife is one good for cutting
this stump will make a good picnic table
a good dress for the office
an arms limitation agreement beneficial to all countries
the beneficial effects of a temperate climate
the experience was good for her
we all had a good time

definitions.text: having or showing knowledge and skill and aptitude
examples: a lesser-known but no less skillful composer
the effect was achieved by skillful retouching
gave the house a good cleaning

definitions.text: with or in a close or intimate relationship
examples: my sisters and brothers are near and dear

definitions.text: most suitable or right for a particular purpose
examples: a good time to plant tomatoes
the time is ripe for great sociological changes
it's a good thing that I wasn't there
it is good that you stayed
it is well that no one saw you
a warranty good for two years
the law is already in effect (or in force)
I still have one good leg
a sound mind in a sound body

definitions.text: tending to promote physical well-being; beneficial to health
examples: beneficial effects of a balanced diet
the salutary influence of pure air

definitions.text: (often used as a combining form) in a good or proper or satisfactory manner or to a high standard (`good' is a nonstandard dialectal variant for `well')
examples: the baby can walk pretty good

definitions.text: completely and absolutely (`good' is sometimes used informally for `thoroughly')
